page.title: 19Local Politics
page.content: On 31st May pupils at our School School received a newsletter concerning the selling off of school land that is in 'excess of school requirments' due to falling rolls. parents were bieng asked by the PTA to oppose this. Following up information from the P.T.A. we found this imformation had originated from the {Bexley and Crayford Observer}. We then contacted local government officals who after a long series of phone calls told us that this was merely a Feasability Study to find possible money for the Education Authority. The land would be sold to the local council who would agree not to develop it. The local paper might be jumping the gun and the PTA overreacting but that remains to be seen. by C.Man & G.Powell (17).
